video.name: VEGAN CARROT CAKE BITES - 8 Ingr, 15 min, Grainfree Raw option | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Vegan Carrot Cake Bites! 8 Ingredients, Grainfree. No Refined Sugar 
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2019/03/vegan-carrot-cake-bites.html
MY BOOKS: https://veganricha.com/books

These Spiced Carrot Cake Balls Need just 8 ingredients and 15 minutes. No refined sugar or oil. Roll in coconut or dress with vegan cream cheese glaze. Vegan Glutenfree Grainfree Soyfree Raw option.

The carrots in these balls are roasted for a bit to enhance the flavor, they get sweet and add a baked cake like profile. The carrots then get processed with the rest of the ingredients to make a dough that is shaped into balls or bars. Even with the baking, it takes just 15 mins of active time! Walnuts, spices, dates and coconut flour make these a fudgy spiced delicious treat. These would be no bake if you use raw carrots. 

These Carrot Cake Energy Bites are Easy, taste like carrot cake, are grainfree, oilfree, are naturally sweetened and are ready within minutes! Lets make some.

***************************************************
Hi, I'm Richa! I create flavorful creative recipes that might need a tiny bit more work, but are totally worth it! Recipes generally include gluten-free, soy-free, and oil-free options. I also wrote 2 cookbooks! Vegan Richa's Indian Kitchen & Vegan Richa's Everyday Kitchen. Lets cook!

recipeIngredient: 15  soft dates ((regular size), use 2 less if using large medjool)
1/4 cup almond flour (add more if needed)

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the carrots into 2 inch pieces. Add to a baking dish, cover the dish with parchment (optional) and bake for at 400 deg F (200 C) for 20 to 25 mins(longer time for fatter carrots). (You can skip this step and use raw carrot, you will need a few tbsp more almond flour later).
recipeInstructions.name: Chop the carrots into 2 inch pieces. Add to a baking dish, cover the dish with parchment (optional) and bake for at 400 deg F (200 C) for 20 to 25 mins(longer time for fatter carrots). (You can skip this step and use raw carrot, you will need a few tbsp more almond flour later).

recipeInstructions.text: Add walnuts to a food processor and pulse to chop into an even coarse mixture
recipeInstructions.name: Add walnuts to a food processor and pulse to chop into an even coarse mixture

recipeInstructions.text: Add the roasted carrots, dates, vanilla, spices and salt and process until the mixture is well combined and doughy.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the roasted carrots, dates, vanilla, spices and salt and process until the mixture is well combined and doughy.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the almond and coconut flours and pulse again to combine. (You can also add other ingredients such as chia seeds, some vanilla protein powder etc instead of some of the almond flour)
recipeInstructions.name: Add the almond and coconut flours and pulse again to combine. (You can also add other ingredients such as chia seeds, some vanilla protein powder etc instead of some of the almond flour)

recipeInstructions.text: If the mixture is too sticky, add a few tbsp more almond flour and 1 tbsp more coconut flour and pulse. Taste and adjust flavor with a tbsp of coconut sugar or maple syrup for sweeter if needed, or add more spices.
recipeInstructions.name: If the mixture is too sticky, add a few tbsp more almond flour and 1 tbsp more coconut flour and pulse. Taste and adjust flavor with a tbsp of coconut sugar or maple syrup for sweeter if needed, or add more spices.

recipeInstructions.text: Shape into balls and roll in shredded coconut. Alternatively, drizzle some vegan cashew cream cheese frosting or,  3 tbsp coconut butter mixed with 1 tbsp of maple syrup, a good pinch of lemon zest and cinnamon.
recipeInstructions.name: Shape into balls and roll in shredded coconut. Alternatively, drizzle some vegan cashew cream cheese frosting or,  3 tbsp coconut butter mixed with 1 tbsp of maple syrup, a good pinch of lemon zest and cinnamon.

recipeInstructions.text: Store refrigerated for upto a 5 days or freeze.
recipeInstructions.name: Store refrigerated for upto a 5 days or freeze.
